title: Impact of Corporate Earnings Reports on Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd Stock's Price Movements

content.text: On April 28, 2021, Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd released its Q1 2021 earnings report. The report showed a net income of $49.7 million, reflecting a 13% increase compared to the previous quarter. Additionally, the bank's earnings per share (EPS) stood at $0.95, surpassing analysts' estimates of $0.85. As a result, the stock price of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd rose by 4% on the day of the earnings release.

On October 27, 2020, Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd announced its Q3 2020 earnings report. The report revealed a net income of $38.1 million, indicating a decline of 20% compared to the same quarter in the previous year. Moreover, the bank's EPS for the quarter was $0.67, falling short of analysts' estimates of $0.72. Consequently, the stock price of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd dropped by 6% on the day of the earnings release.

Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd released its Q2 2021 earnings report on July 27, 2021. The report showed a net income of $50.9 million, reflecting a 2% increase compared to the previous quarter. Although the bank's earnings per share (EPS) of $1.05 surpassed analysts' estimates of $0.97, the stock price experienced a minor decrease of 1% on the day of the earnings release. This suggests that other market factors or sentiments may have influenced the stock price movement.

On February 9, 2021, Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd reported its Q4 2020 earnings. The earnings report revealed a net income of $42.4 million, indicating a decline of 5% compared to the same quarter in the previous year. Additionally, the bank's EPS for the quarter was $0.78, which was below analysts' estimates of $0.80. Subsequently, the stock price of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd dropped by 3% on the day of the earnings release.

Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd's Q1 2020 earnings report, announced on April 28, 2020, displayed a net income of $33.2 million, indicating a decline of 29% compared to the previous quarter. Furthermore, the bank's EPS for the quarter was $0.60, falling short of analysts' estimates of $0.68. Consequently, the stock price of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd dropped by 8% on the day of the earnings release.

Based on recent examples, it can be observed that the corporate earnings reports of Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Ltd have impacted the stock's price movements. Positive earnings surprises, such as surpassing analysts' estimates or achieving growth in net income, tend to lead to an increase in the stock price. Conversely, negative earnings surprises, such as missing analysts' estimates or experiencing a decline in net income, often result in a decrease in the stock price. However, it is essential to consider that other market factors and sentiments can also influence the stock price, as seen in the case of minor price changes despite positive earnings beats.

news.headline: Butterfield Announces Share Repurchase Program
news.summary: HAMILTON, Bermuda, December 05, 2023--The Bank of N.T. Butterfield & Son Limited ("Butterfield" or the "Bank") (BSX: NTB.BH; NYSE: NTB) today announced that its Board of Directors has approved a $90 million ordinary share repurchase program ("the Share Repurchase Program") pursuant to which the Bank is authorized to purchase up to 3.5 million of its ordinary shares through December 31, 2024.
